messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:12): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, why does the latest CVS version not use the Editor's draft template?

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:28): I've made some edits that still need to be checked in
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:29): oh, ok
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:29): crap, it should be using the editor's draft template.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:29): can you do that?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:30): Yes, it will get fixed with the next check in
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:31): i meant checking in
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:33): Hmm, Android SDK includes Ogg Vorbis
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:33): i did not know
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:35): Hmph, html5lib cheats with reprocessing and fostering
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:35): like if you say <table><a><a> then the implied </a> doesn't go through the "in table" mode
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:35): needs to learn how to use W3C CVS from my Mac, instead of having to do it from my home PC all the time
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:36): you can only say cheats if we fail a test :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:36): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: surely the top of the stack is no longer IN_TABLE at that point?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:36): You fail a test that does <table><a><a> and expects a certain number of parse errors :-)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, the date is still broken
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:36): or do I misremember stuff?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, you should omit the date parameter
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:37): it has been a while since I have thought about the tree builder
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:37): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, it's ok to supress parse errors i believe :)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:37): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Ah, yes, the </a> shouldn't get fostered, but it should still go through "in table" and generate a parse error
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:38): can't find an instance in html5lib where it would cause a different parse tree
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:39): oops, I still had the date set in my .bat file. Fixed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:41): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, did you see the e-mail about dumping StaticNodeList?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:41): the one from you in response to me?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:42): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapi/2008Feb/0080.html ?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:42): yeah

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:42): jgraham__: the commonality thread you replied to reminds me of http://www.nytimes.com/2008/01/20/magazine/20wwln-freak-t.html?_r=4&ref=magazine&oref=slogin&oref=slogin&oref=slogin&oref=slogin
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:43): though sending that link to the list would probably be seen as a flame

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:44): it's a rather complicated change, since I need to change/remove all occurrences of StaticNodeList, define the NodeList to be returned as not live and make sure no errors are introduced in the process
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:45): true
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:45): I'll give it a go
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:53): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, any suggested text for how to define the node list as static?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:56): return the list of elements as a static object implementing the NodeList interface
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:56): something in that direction
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:57): or maybe "static NodeList object"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:02): ends up changing his 'fostering' flag to be an integer, so he can handle nested fostering without cheating
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:03): http://philip.html5.org/tools/parser/?%3Ctable%3E%3Ctr%3E%3Ctable%3E - now with slightly fewer infinite loops, hooray

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:06): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, "The NodeList object returned by the querySelectorAll()  methods must not be live. Subsequent changes to the structure of the underlying document must not be reflected in the NodeList  object. The object must instead contain a list of matching Element nodes that were in the document at the time the list was created."
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:08): s/must not be live/must be static/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:09): or s/must not be live/must be static (not live)/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:09): the other statements can be phrased as statements of facts instead of conformance criteria
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:11): "must be static (not live)" works, where _live_ is a link to the defintion of live lists in DOM3
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:11): i think it's universally understood what it means, but you could do that
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:12): yeah, I just wanted to make it absolutely clear
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:14): http://www.w3.org/mid/op.t2kr1qnf64w2qv edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e-t60.oslo.opera.com - internal server error?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:14): wfm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:14): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-forms-tf/2007Nov/0000.html
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:15): Oh, it worked on the third attempt
